topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d7481c6368722373940000#post_53d7481c6368722373940000
But Yahtzee tries to present his views as fact and he often takes time out of his already short reviews to create this air of egotism and smugness that makes me want to punch in the mouth. He'll spend a good 2 minutes making fun of people who like Nintendo games and products just because "OMG Nintendo is for children. I'm go play my game with guns and be mature." At least Bennett is intelligent enough to back up his claims. Hell he's humble enough to admit when he's wrong.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d7495563687273f12d0000#post_53d7495563687273f12d0000
But He hates Games with mindless gun based action!

He praised nintendo for being a company that still makes game consoles.

And He has stated over and over that He's accentuating the negative because it's funny, You can usually tell if he actually hates a game or if he's just exaggerating.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body: And so, we made our 1000nd page with the power of opinions. Let's party another day.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d749d06368726ff74e0000#post_53d749d06368726ff74e0000
But it's NOT funny. When people watch a six minute video game review they want FACTS not humor. And he still makes fun of Nintendo fans. That's WORSE than badmouthing a company. If you feel the need to insult someone for liking something you might need to reevaluate your priorities. Bennett doesn't insult someone for liking something. He just insults the thing you like.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d756036368726ea0ad0000#post_53d756036368726ea0ad0000
It's a long running series of Tokusatsu (Even older than Kamen rider)

They're basically about Men who fuse with Giant aliens among the stars, Get involved with special military Squads that Defends the world from Kaiju (I think so) And the Men can become the Aliens in order to fight the kaiju.

If you like Godzilla, You should like Ultra (The original, Ultraseven, And Mebius are good starts from what I've heard)

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d79f1763687206b5050000#post_53d79f1763687206b5050000
Tell that to the middle east.

The sad thing is that over the past twenty five years nearly two million people in Afghanistan have died due to the shit that goes on there.

The good news though is that the war in Afghanistan, the Mexican drug war, the Egyptian crisis and the Sudanese civil war are starting to calm down.

The Israeli-Palestine conflict, Islamic insurgency in Nigeria, Pakistan, Syria, Iraq, Central Africa show no sign of stopping any time soon.

As for Ukraine the rebels are screwed in the long run and have been continuously been getting pushed away from the major cities.  Even if they were to join Russia all they'd really get is a bunch of farmland, whoop the fucking do.  The only city they really can realistically maintain is Izvarino.  If they lose control of Izvarino they're fucked.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d7a19e63687205c6aa0000#post_53d7a19e63687205c6aa0000

Middle east... That's another history. I mean, hundreds of people there die *every day*. You cannot even go to the store without knowing that you house could be destroyed by a bomb or just walk in the streets without being shooted. 

The Mexican drug war... I don't think that is starting to calm down. There are massacres in everywhere! Narcos killing eachother and people dying because they were in the middle of the damn way.
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d7a6bf63687209027a0100#post_53d7a6bf63687209027a0100
Last year over ten thousand people died; so far in the mexican drug war for the year only a couple hundreds.  While tragic the difference between a "conflict" and a "war" is number of deaths.  The reason why I hesitate to call the Mexican drug war still a war is that the number of deaths has drastically dropped from the ten thousand of 2013 to only a couple hundred.

There will always be conflict in the world, but over the last couple of decades the number of deaths in war overall has been drastically reduced.  While conflicts are tragic they are nothing to write home about.  The reason why not to get bent out of shape over conflicts is that it means a war has cooled down enough to the point where you're more likely to die from a car accident or such.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d7a6bf63687209027a0100#post_53d7a6bf63687209027a0100
